data.name: Array Reflection
data.description: ### Task You are given an array arr, an index i and optionally an index j. If j is undefined, you should return an array where each of the elements is reflected around the element at position i. If j is defined, you should return an array where each of the elements is reflected around the imaginary line between element at position i and element at position j. #### Details - array arr contains at least 2 elements - array elements are digits 0 - 9, but could be anything really, as the content of the array is irrelevant to solve this kata - duplicates are allowed - indices i and j (if defined) are integers, which can be positive, negative or zero - zero and positive should be counted from left to right, with zero being the left-most element; on overflow, wrap around and continue from the left - negative should be counted from right to left, with -1 being the right-most element; on overflow, wrap around and continue from the right - index j (if defined) can be either to the left or right of index i, but always has a minimum cyclic distance to i of 1 - note that using certain values of i and j results in generic algorithms such as reversing an array or swapping elements --- ### Algorithm #### Reflection around an element When reflecting around a point, the cyclic distances - respectively to the right and left - between any given point and the pivot point at index i are swapped. As an interesting edge case, a point that reflects around itself, remains at the same position, as the distance to itself is always zero. ``` Example: "Reflection around the center element" arr: [0, 1, 2] i: 1 return: [2, 1, 0] point before: after: distance: 0 0 -> 1 1 <- 0 1 1 <- 2 <- 0 0 -> 2 -> 1 2 1 1 1 0 2 2 -> 0 -> 1 1 <- 0 <- 2 2 1 <- 2 2 -> 1 1 ``` #### Reflection around the imaginary line between elements When reflecting around the imaginary line between 2 elements, the cyclic distances - respectively to the right and left - between any given point and the pivot line between index i and j are swapped. ``` Example: "Reflection around the center imaginary line" arr: [0, 1, 2, 3] i: 1 j: 2 return: [3, 2, 1, 0] point before: after: distance: 0 0 -> 1 -> | | <- 1 <- 0 2 | <- 2 <- 3 <- 0 0 -> 3 -> 2 -> | 3 1 1 -> | | <- 1 1 | <- 2 <- 3 <- 0 <- 1 1 -> 0 -> 3 -> 2 -> | 4 2 2 -> 3 -> 0 -> 1 -> | | <- 1 <- 0 <- 3 <- 2 4 | <- 2 2 -> | 1 3 3 -> 0 -> 1 -> | | <- 1 <- 0 <- 3 3 | <- 2 <- 3 3 -> 2 -> | 2 ```
